intro: Alcanna spinosa, commonly known as the spinous alcanna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Alcanna spinosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
